intro: Coccoloba corrientina, commonly known as the Caribbean beauty or coral tree, is a member of the Polygonaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often bright green with a waxy texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. Coccoloba corrientina is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
